dublin_core.dcvalue: Cornelia Kip Lee FHI 360 gave this presentation on the new mHealth eLearning course for the September 17 2013 meeting of the mHealth Working Group This course mHealth Basics Introduction to Mobile Technology for Health is a self paced three hour eLearning course available free to all on the USAID Global Health eLearning Center platform that provides an introduction to the emerging field of mHealth and an overview of best practices for mHealth solution development The focus of the course is on mHealth applications commonly used in developing country contexts The course covers the definition of mHealth its potential uses benefits and limitations as well as various applications in developing countries The course also covers preliminary conclusions of mHealth evidence and describes recommended best practices of mHealth solution planning design monitoring and evaluation scale up and sustainability Resources for additional information about mHealth are also included
